findings.title: Reentrancy vulnerability in Collect()
findings.explanation: The Collect() function performs an external call (msg.sender.call.value(_am)()) before updating the caller’s balance. Because call forwards all remaining gas and there is no reentrancy guard or prior state change, a malicious contract can re-enter Collect() in its fallback and drain funds.

findings.title: Missing access control on SetMinSum and SetLogFile
findings.explanation: Both SetMinSum() and SetLogFile() are publicly callable and only prevented from running once 'intitalized' is true. Until someone calls Initialized(), any attacker can call these to arbitrarily change the withdrawal threshold or point the logger at a malicious contract (potentially causing denial-of-service).

unmatched_predictions.title: Missing access control on SetMinSum and SetLogFile
